content.description: Start on the slab to the right of a scooped arete. Climb the slab until it runs out of holds and forces you left around the arete and into the overhanging scoop. Climb left through the overhanging section on some good jug rails, into the chimney. Climb the chimney/arete for a few feet and then break out right back onto the face. Traverse the moss at the top to the anchors.
content.protection:
There are two 5-6" trees at the top of the wall directly above the overhanging section. There is a larger tree about 15' back from the wall. The two 5-6" trees make a great anchor for Truth is the Way.  

  A large brush might be useful for the slab face.
content.location:
Located on a large clean slabby face to the right of a right facing corner with a large chimney. Start to the right of an overhanging section on a relatively clean slab face.

 This route shares a relative start with Ignoramus.

content.description: Sit down start on the rock jutting up and match hands above you. Start pulling up to reach for the multiple roofs to touch the top. You're able to get on top, but there's no where to walk off. Downclimbing is only good way down, the deck is a bit sketchy.
content.protection: Pads and spotters highly necessary. The deck has several large boulders with pointed edges that will hurt a lot if you fell.
content.location: NE corner of the Ignoreland area, where the trail on top of the ledges turns around to come through the main corridor. The bottom of the route has SAT spraypainted on the rock face, and there's two fallen decaying trees near the rock.

content.description: Super height dependent. Face / Slab climb.
content.location: To the right of the arete that has Back Scratcher .. North of the Island.

content.description: Balance and techy movements take you up the slightly less than vertical climbing. The crux is finding a trustworthy foot to gain the pods overhead. Pinch and step on more defined features towards the finish.
content.protection: Natural anchors at the top. Two trees simul with cords or long slings.
content.location: North of Back Scratcher - Ignoramus climbs up the right side of the slabby face.

content.description:
Always take assistance rating, Easy enough to traverse in tennis, Need to be strong enough to hold on, For the schmeary feets.

 Increasing variability and difficulty,  Weeerk those heal hooks.. I'm not so inclined.
content.location:
Start in the downturned crack to the left,  follow it along the upper juggy ledge to the right, into and under the belly of the beasts feets.

 Climbing can be dangerous,  in the driest of conditions.

content.description: Exposed edges climbed regularly by kids in tennis. Confidence in climbing shoes...
content.location:
Started in the light crack to the right,

moving upward the flake line, 

To have a seat and view,

To crawl back down again.

Across the fin, toward the crack, To a lovely knee bar transition within,

To connect to the fledglings traverse,If you like...

content.description: Crux is usually avoiding the rock behind you.. hence "Back scratcher."
content.location: Large chimney north of the Island. To the left of Look Ma No Hands.

content.description: These are the climbs that are typically ignored, north of the Island; separate from the Main Wall formation. Back Scratcher and Look Ma No Hands are here, among others.
